pokemon:
Board: Lots of Rocks, Lone Starly at the 
           center
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Starly every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Glalie]/[Ampharos]/
[Manectric]

Ampharos, Aurorus,
Tyranitar, Avalugg

Zapdos, Raikou

None
srankingStrategy:
C5 - F2 or A1 - C5 to get a good
start. You may want to stick with
Glalie as your Mega if you want
to Mega Evolve
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Move+5 will do this good

pokemon:
Board: Rocks at 5th and 6th row
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Rocks after 3 turns x2
          Adds 1 Row in Barriers after 3 turns
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Heracross]

Gengar, Zoroark,
Heracross, Scizor

Genesect, Yveltal

Giratina
srankingStrategy:
Just your old simple stage. Get
damage fast with Crowd Control or
Power of 4+
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

This can be done itemless

If you are getting short on moves, then
add Move+5

pokemon:
Board: 3 Rocks at the bottom, 1 Goomy
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Barriers after 3 turns x2
          Randomly Between:
          Adds 4 Rocks after a turn
          Adds 3 Rocks and 1 Goomy after a
          turn
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Altaria]/[Glalie]/[Gengar]

Haxorus, Snubbull,
Avalugg

Xerneas, Dragonite,
Articuno

Rayquaza, Diancie
srankingStrategy:
Gengar would be good if the other
Super Effective Megas don't work.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

This can be done itemless

If you are getting short on moves, then
add Move+5

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Mime Jr on Row 4 after 4
          turns
          Randomly Between:
          Adds 2-5 Barrier if no 5+ lines combo
          Adds 2 Mime Jr on Row 1, 3, or 5 if
          no 5+ lines combo
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Heracross]

Gengar, Zoroark,
Heracross, Scizor

Genesect, Yveltal

Giratina
srankingStrategy:
Not hard even with the disruptions.
Just do the same trick with Gothita
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

This can be done itemless

If you are getting short on moves, then
add Move+5

pokemon:
Board: Starvia and Starly in 2nd and 3rd
           Row covered in Barriers in a zigzag
           pattern
Initial: None
Timer: Adds Staravia and Starly in 2nd and
          3rd Row (this will match them and 
          eliminate the barriers)
clearingStrategy:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Gengar]

Ampharos, Aurorus,
Tyranitar, Avalugg

Zapdos, Raikou

None
srankingStrategy:
If you want to eliminate the Barriers
and other Pokemon, use a combination
of Tyranitar and Avalugg (although this
is not very efficient)

I discourage the use of Glalie here
because its ability (Chill) will delay
the disruption. To eliminate the Starly
and Staravia after the disruption, you
must clear the 4th-6th column (seems
hard but with 1st row support it would
be not that hard)
notes:
Moves: At least 3 moves left

This can be done itemless but will
require luck after the disruption

If you are getting short on moves, then
add Move+5

Another strategy: Bring your own
Starly and/or Staravia. With this you can
potentially remove the barriers without
using any item and the Mega will do
the damage. The downfall to this is the
catch rate which would require Great Balls
or lot of attempt which makes adding a
Move+5 better

pokemon:
Board: 5th and 6th Row in Metal Blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds a 1x2 Metal Blocks in 1st and
          2nd Row after a turn x4
          Adds 4 Barrier after 3 turns
          Repeat the last disruption
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Heracross]

Gengar, Zoroark,
Heracross, Scizor

Genesect, Yveltal

Giratina, Darkrai
srankingStrategy:
Focus on Power of 4+ here and
Mega evolving your Mega. With so 
many Metal Blocks on board at first,
Crowd Control will lose some damage.
After the Metal Blocks, you may want
to start doing damage with Crowd
Control
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

A combination of Move+5
and DD will be sufficient to do this

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Metal Blocks
Timer: Adds 4 Metal Blocks every 2 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Mawile]/[Gengar]

Bronzong, Steelix,
Nidoqueen, Nidoking

None

Dialga, Jirachi
srankingStrategy:
Dialga will get through the Metal
Blocks here very easy. If you
dont have Dialga, you may stick
with Bronzong. Not a very hard
stage
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Very easy itemless

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Rocks after 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Blaziken]/[Gengar]/
[Any]

Ninetales, Tyranitar,
Aurorus

Delphox, Heatran

None
srankingStrategy:
Very easy with an All-Fire team.
Have Delphox start the combo with
Pyre and have M-Blaziken bomb the
board. For those who dont have
M-Blaziken, you can switch to M-
Gengar for a free complexity and would
work just fine
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Very easy itemless

Otherwise, add Move+5

pokemon:
Board: Scatterbug in Barrier
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
[Blaziken]/[Gengar]

Ninetales, Tyranitar,
Aurorus, Scatterbug

Delphox, Heatran

None
srankingStrategy:
Bring Scatterbug with you otherwise
you cant do this. Focus on
getting rid of some Scatterbug at first.
Both M-Blaziken and M-Gengar work
wonders here
notes:
Moves: At least 2 moves left

If you want to do this itemless, you will
require luck (easily just go and watch, move
1 time or try again)

Move+5 will do this very very easy

pokemon:
Board: 8 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Rocks after 2 turns x2
          Randomly Between:
          Adds 4 Barriers after 2 turns
          Adds 3-4 Rocks after 2 turns
          Repeat last disruption
clearingStrategy:
[Blaziken]/[Gengar]/
[Charizard Y]

Ninetales, Tyranitar,
Aurorus

Delphox, Heatran

None
srankingStrategy:
Once again, M-Blaziken is the best
for this stage. If you dont have it,
then M-Gengar seems to be just fine.
Same strategy with Scatterbug. Just
get Pyre+Mega Combo and you'll do
this good (No items needed)

You may want to take care of the
barriers on top while slowly Mega
Evolving your Pokemon (assuing
you dont use Mega Start) The 4
Barriers on the top is what you need
to take out as the other 4 on the bottom
is not that crucial.

With the release of M-Charizard Y,
you get another alternate for Blaziken.
It's Mega Effect is perfect for clearing
away Vivillon's disruptions
notes:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

M-Blaziken + Move+5 + DD will be good
enough for this (Also add up some luck)
M-Blaziken will rack up damage if you
get a successful whole field "bomb"

M-Gengar + Complexity + DD is also
good getting 2 less Pokemon on the
board each time you get a Mega Gengar
match (You may try not using Complexity
at first since this is beatable without using
a Complexity. You may also want to get
Move+5 for safety net)

pokemon:

Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers and 2 Meditite in a
          2x4 blocks after 6 moves

Note: Meditite and Barrier will only spawn
    on the blocks where the initial Meditite is

[Mewtwo]/[Slowbro]/
[Gengar]

Salamence, Braviary

Mewtwo

Victini, Cresselia, Lugia
srankingStrategy:
M-Gengar team will do this
easily itemless
notes:
Moves: At least 8 moves left
Itemless can do this with M-Gengar

Sawk, Mienshao,
Pangoro, Conkeldurr

Lucario

None
srankingStrategy:
This stage is very easy. The health
is very low you can do this itemless
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left
Itemless can do this

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Randomly between:
           Adds 1-2 Metal Blocks if you didn't
           get a 4+ combo
           Adds a Kirlia if you didn't get a 4+
           combo

56% Health: Randomly between:
                   Adds 2-5 Barrier if you didn't
                   get a 4+ combo
                   Adds 2 Kirlia if you didn't get
                   a 4+ combo
clearingStrategy:
[Mawile]/[Gengar]

Bronzong, Steelix,
Nidoqueen

Cobalion

Jirachi, Dialga
srankingStrategy:
You can do a Jirachi+Mawile combo
here. If you didnt get a good match,
you may want to use Cobalion's Power
of 4+ instead. An alternative Mega
would be Gengar which is also good
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left
Move+5 can do this

pokemon:
Board: Starly, Staravia, Staraptor, Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Randomly between:
          Adds 4 Barriers after 3 turns
          Adds 5 Starly after 3 turns
          Adds 5 Staravia after 3 turns

39% Health: Adds 4 Barriers after 2 turns
                   Adds a Staraptor after 2 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Manectric]/[Ampharos]/
[Glalie]/[Gengar]

Tyranitar, Ampharos, 
Aurorus

Zapdos, Raikou,
Terrakion

Kyurem, Gigalith
srankingStrategy:
For initial, A6 to F4 is a good way
to start. This will wipe all Starly,
Staravia and Staraptor on the board.

Then, eject the disruptions with 
Tyranitar, matching them together
will waste your moves.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left
Move+5, DD and Mega Start will be
enough for this. You can use M-Gengar
with a team of super effectives, it works
quite well. Using Gengar, you can drop
the Mega Start as Gengar evolves fast.

Expensive option (but ultra reliable)
Complexity + DD (Move+5 for safety net)
Seems to work on most. But the former
strategy should work well now that we have
stronger pok√©mon  (Kyurem for example)

pokemon:
Board: H-Barrier, 6 Klink, 3 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: After 5 turns, will gain a disruption:
           Adds 3 Rocks every turn
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Garchomp]

Ninetales, Excadrill,
Conkeldurr

Lucario, Blaziken,
Heatran, Moltres

Groudon, Garchomp,
Emboar
srankingStrategy:
Emboar is good for clearing the
barriers away. While doing it, you 
may want to Mega Evolve your Mega.
The best Mega would be Lucario to
wipe away the disruptions away.

With the release of Palkia, Palkia
is doing a better Barrier Basher than
Emboar since it can destroy 3 barriers.
(Cresselia and Diancie are both NVE
so don't use them)
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left
Move+5 can do this

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Barriers, 5 Metal Blocks,
           3 Mr. Mime after 6 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Heracross]/
[Sharpedo]/[Banette]

Gengar, Zoroark,
Heracross, Scizor

Genesect, Yveltal,
Absol

Giratina, Darkrai
srankingStrategy:
You'll need to rely on Darkrai's Sleep
Charm to get rid of disruptions for a
while. The disruption is crazy and
will fill your board unless you are
using a DD. Just focus on all damage
you can get. Giratina's Power of 4+,
Genesect's Crowd Control and
Darkrai are the best to use.

Seems Absol as Mind Zapper seems
to also work to prevent disruptions
(aside from Darkrai's Sleep Charm)

For those who are using Banette,
Shuppet is a better choice for a 
Mind Zap if you gave it some levels
(For more Power for Banette's Mega
Effect)
notes:
Moves: At least 12 moves left
Move+5 can do this

Otherwise, add up a DD

pokemon:
Board: 6 Rocks, 6 Klang with 3 of them
           covered in Barrier
Initial: None
Timer: None

Moves <= 9: Adds 3 Metal Blocks after 2
                    turns
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Garchomp]

Ninetales, Excadrill,
Conkeldurr

Lucario, Blaziken,
Heatran, Moltres

Groudon, Garchomp,
Emboar
srankingStrategy:
First thing to do is get rid of the
barriers so after 5 turns, Pokemon will
skyfall. Emboar will do this quite easily
The disruption is not that hard as Mega
Lucario and Mega Garchomp can get
rid of them easily. For this, Mega
Lucario is better because of faster
Mega Evolving
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
Move+5 can do this

pokemon:
Board: 4 Gothita, 3 Gothorita, 1 Gothitelle, 1
           Metal Block, 4 Barrier
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Barriers after 3 turns
           Adds 3 Metal Blocks after 2 turns
           Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Heracross]/
[Sharpedo]/[Absol]/
[Banette]

Gengar, Zoroark,
Heracross, Scizor

Genesect, Yveltal

Giratina, Darkrai
srankingStrategy:
Another very hard stage. DD will
help lessen the threats if you can't
beat it with Move+5.

Try clearing the Gothita and Gothorita
first by matching them (Even by doing
this a Gothita and a Gothitelle will still
exist) D5-B4/E4 , D6-C4, C4-D4 is
one way of clearing them away
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
Move+5 and DD seems to be the minimum
items to use here.

Mega Start and DD can do this (you can
use Move+5 if you are unsure)

pokemon:
Board: 6 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Rocks and 6 Goomy in an
           alternate of 2 each in 2 Columns
           after 2 moves x3
          Adds 6 Rocks and 6 Sliggoo in an
           alternate of 2 each in 2 Columns
           after 2 moves x3 

Additional Support: Pidgey. Will be replaced
                             by Happiny if Pidgey is
                             added as Support
clearingStrategy:
[Altaria]/[Glalie]/[Latias]

Haxorus, Avalugg,
Goomy

Xerneas, Dragonite,
Articuno

Rayquaza, Latias
srankingStrategy:
A Hard stage since this one has
additional support. I suggest bringing
Goomy along since it is Super
Effective and appears in disruption.
For Mega, the best one would be
Altaria since Goomy helps it with its
ability (Mega Boost)

With the addition of Latias, this stage
becomes more easier. Use Mega
Latias instead if you have it
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
DD, Move+5 is the minimum

Complexity + DD will also be good (in this
case, dont add Goomy to your team)

pokemon:
Board: 7 Rocks, 1 Meditite, 1 Medicham
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2-3 Metal Blocks after 2 turns


Move <= 10: Randomly between:
                    Adds 1 Medicham, 2 Metal
                    Blocks after 2 turns
                    Adds 4 Barriers after 2 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo]/[Slowbro]/
[Gengar]

Salamence, Braviary

Mewtwo

Victini, Cresselia, Lugia
srankingStrategy:
Lugia ejects the Medicham/Meditite
away. Cresselia is also good for
clearing away the Barriers. Seems to
be beatable only with items (Move+5
is minimum)

Gengar seems to work alright here too
notes:
Moves: At least 9 moves left
DD and Move+5 can do this.

Or DD, Mega Start and Move+5 for full
effect

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Grimer every 2 turns

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Marowak, Grimer

Mewtwo

Cresselia, Victini,
Garchomp

Very easy. Grimer with Crowd Control
even helps you here
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left
You can do this itemless. You may want
to try adding Grimer to your team if you
caught it first before S-Ranking

If all else failed, use Move+5

Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Grimer, 6 Barrier in same

[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Marowak, Grimer

Mewtwo

Cresselia, Victini,
Garchomp

Cresselia is good here for getting
rid of the barriers. Any of the 3
Mega works good in this stage.
notes:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

Otherwise, it can be done with Move+5

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds Metal Blocks on row 1 every
           turn for 5 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Heracross]/
[Medicham]/[Gengar]

Heracross, Volcarona,
Conkeldurr

Xerneas, Genesect

Pinsir
srankingStrategy:
The board will get full of Metal Blocks
in no time. Still easy to beat because
it stops after 5 turns and some Metal
Blocks will disappear at a time.
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Move+5 will guarantee this

If you want to do this itemless, try
M-Gengar. M-Gengar can get a huge combo
when some blocks are gone which will be
5 turns left. Make sure not to delay
Pawniard's disruption when Mega Evolving
so you'll have a free one turn.

pokemon:
Board: 8 Skitty, 5 Barriers, 3 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Any of below:
          Adds 3 Skitty after 3 moves
          Adds 2 Barrier after 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Any]

Sawk, Medicham,
Conkeldurr

Lucario, Gallade

None
srankingStrategy:
The first thing to do is match the
Skitty at the center. This opens the
3rd Column for skyfall. Then use the
remaining Skitty to match the other
Skitty blocking the skyfall at other
columns.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
Seems to be beatable itemless. Some
say that adding Skitty to the stage helps

Move+5 will do if you are having trouble

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: Disrupts you if you didn't make a 2+
           combo. Either of:
           Adds 3 Rocks
           Adds 3 Wingull

51% Health: Disrupts you if you didn't make
                   a 3+ combo. Either of:
                   Adds 3 Wingull
                   Adds 5 Rocks

Added Support: Rocks
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Manectric]/
[Ampharos]/[Glalie]

Ampharos, Tyranitar,
Aerodactyl

Terrakion, Articuno

Regice
srankingStrategy:
Not really that hard. It was easy
to combo despite the additional
support.

Note: Eject can sometimes Eject
the Wingull away but it does not work
100% of the time. A user PM me
that Eject does indeed work on this
stage and even sent a proof video. If it
doesn't work, dont blame the guide
notes:
Moves: At least 12 moves left
Seems that it is beatable itemless.

Or Move+5 will do

pokemon:
Board: 3 Kirlia, 3 Ralts, 15 Barriers with 3
           in each row (See board)
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Rock after 2 moves

44% Health: Adds 2 3x1 Barriers after 2
                   turns
clearingStrategy:
[Mawile]

Bronzong, Steelix,
Nidoqueen, Muk

Cobalion

Jirachi, Dialga
srankingStrategy:
Stage has been made easier with less
HP. Not sure how it affects the 
clearing and S ranking strategies.

The barriers are hard to control
without someone to destroy it.
Cresselia or Palkia may be used to
get rid of some of them.
notes:
Moves: At least 9 moves left
Seems to be doable with Move+5
if you have Jirachi + M-Mawile.

If Move+5 didn't work for you, you might
want to swap Jirachi for Muk (if leveled)
or Nidoqueen and add Mega Start. Note
that M-Mawile's Mega ability will only
clear half the initial barriers when triggered
so you have to clear the leftovers yourself.
If the Disruption is hard for you, you may
need a DD but I don't recommend it.

Now, with the mighty M-Rayquaza, it's
reliable to use Mega Start and Moves +5.
Even though Rayquaza is Not Very
Effective, it can remove the Ralts and Kirlia
and overall make you able to combo very
nicely (thanks for the suggestion!)

pokemon:
Board: 3 Klink, 6 Klang, 6 Klinklang,
           Metal Blocks all around, Barrier on
           1st Row
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: 2 Rows of Klink, 2 Rows of Klang,
           2 Rows of Klinklang will skyfall.
           Afterwards, all tile that will fall are
           Metal Blocks
clearingStrategy: Any
srankingStrategy:
Pokemon you use doesn't matter.
Here is the solution:
B2-E3, D3-D2,
C4-E3, C5-C4,
E5-B3
notes:
Moves: At least 0 move left
Always S-Rank

pokemon:
Board: 4 Meditite, 2 in Barrier, 2 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Metal Blocks after 2 turns

31% Health: Either of the following:
                   Adds 5 Metal Blocks after 2
                   turns
                   Adds 1 Row of Barrier after 2
                   turns
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo]/[Slowbro]/
[Gengar]

Salamence, Braviary

Mewtwo

Victini, Cresselia, Lugia
srankingStrategy:
The HP total has been decreased by a 
third, so it definitely makes this stage
a lot easier, but I don't know how 
much.

The HP was very high. About near
double regular Medicham's HP.
Lugia can Eject the Meditite's away
but after that it has no really use.
Besides, the Meditite will become
Metal Blocks anyway. Victini and
Cresselia are supports for Mega
Mewtwo Y if you are going to use it.
Cresselia may be good if it decided to
throw barriers at you. Only use
Braviary if you wish to use Gengar
and Sky Blast Team (with Salamence
and Lugia)
notes:
Moves: At least 11 moves left
Move+5, DD, Mega Start with Mewtwo Y
and at least 2 Psychich seems good.

Complexity + Gengar will leave only
2 other Pokemon on the board which is
very good. However, you'll need a DD
to constantly stop the Metal Blocks
from Spawning.
